newsitem.title: USA: AMR strike could cost Dade Cty, Fla millions - mayor.
newsitem.headline: AMR strike could cost Dade Cty, Fla millions - mayor.

text.p: A strike by pilots of AMR Corp could wreak havoc on Dade County, Fla.'s economy, costing it about $400 million over 30 days, county mayor Alex Penelas said Thursday on cable television station CNBC.

Penelas in an interview described this weekend as one of the busiest of the year. The threatened strike would come during two major tourist events in Miami -- the annual boat show and the Coconut Grove Art Festival.
"It is already having an impact," Penelas said.
Economists have estimated that American Airlines generates nearly $4 billion a year in the south Florida economy and some 114,000 jobs are indirectly tied to the carrier.
American employs 9,000 people in Miami with a payroll of $33 million a month.
The airline accounts for 52 percent of the flights and 47 percent of the passengers at Miami International Airport.

Additionally, the threat of a strike is forcing Miami's cruise companies to re-route passengers sailing from the busy Port of Miami. Royal Caribbean alone has had to rebook 10,000 passengers on flights to Miami to catch their cruises.
As many as 25,000 cruise ship passengers leave Miami on a typical weekend day, and most of them travel by air to Miami.
Penelas and other mayors of cities that depend on American Airlines were in Washington, D.C., on Wednesday to request President Clinton intervene and prevent the strike.
